snippet: President Recep Tayyip Erdogan turned the tables on his European counterparts, saying the best way to solve the migration crisis was to help contain the war in Syria.

byline.contributor: James Kanter reported from Brussels, and Tim Arango from Istanbul. Alison Smale contributed reporting from Berlin.
byline.original: By JAMES KANTER and TIM ARANGO

abstract: Turkish Pres Recep Tayyip Erdogan, during state visit to Belgium, asserts that European Union leaders can best resolve migration crisis by more directly addressing Syrian civil war and presses for creation of no-fly zone; remarks point to way that Turkey's normal relations with Europe has been reversed as country leverages its major role in managing refugees.
